title: New cross-platform appveyor setup
body:
The PR substantially broadens the use of appveyor for testing. The old setup is fully removed and a new one is put in place -- with the hope that it is more structured, and easier to maintain. Key features:

- (almost) full set of tests on Windows, Linux, and MacOS tests (incl SSH connectivity)
- possibility for interactive debugging for all CI runs enabled by default
- per CI-run configurable Python version (a consistent 3.8 at the moment)
- `datalad-installer` integration for flexible deployment of git-annex variant (see examples inside)
- ability to install "system packages" via apt or homebrew by simply listing their names
- Test run environment configured to have reasonably short path names (to avoid mysterious glitches from such failures)
- coverage submission for all platforms
- retains all log files (at least for now) so linking them in issues is meaningful (unlike with github actions). Exhibit A: [First ever appveyor run](https://ci.appveyor.com/project/mih/datalad/build/1.0.1)

The test suite is split into 9 separate runs across all platforms. Each run aims for a duration of ~30min to leave time for debugging without extra fiddling. When appveyor is paid in full (10 workers), this should give a turn-around latency of <45min.

In order to get here (and the expansion of the windows tests in particular) I had to make a number of fixes (split into dedicated commits). The most notable is the discontinuation of the `with_testrepos` decorator (and associated machinery) in the tests of core functionality.

There are still a few tests failing. I have filed dedicated issues for them:

- [x] `git-annex cannot create directory` #5291 (osx)
- [x] `datalad.support.tests.test_parallel.test_gracefull_death` #5296 (win)
- [x] `datalad.distribution.tests.test_create_sibling.test_target_ssh_simple` #5298 (linux)
- [x] `datalad.cmdline.tests.test_main.test_help_np` #5299 (osx)
- [x] `datalad.plugin.tests.test_plugins.test_no_annex` #5300 (win)
- [x] `datalad.customremotes.tests.test_archives.test_basic_scenario` #5301 (osx)
- [x] `datalad.distributed.tests.test_ria_basics.test_remote_layout` #5302 (osx)

In order to be able to use the RDP connection to the windows working, you will need a password that I will provide. For the SSH connection, you will need a dedicated SSH private key. Using dedicated aliases makes the connection relatively simple. I suggest:

```
alias appveyor_rdp="xfreerdp /cert:ignore /dynamic-resolution /u:appveyor /p:PASSWORDFROMME"
alias appveyor_ssh="ssh -i ~/.ssh/id_KEYFROMME_rsa -o StrictHostKeyChecking=no"
```

With these two, one can log in with the credentials shown at the (relatively) top of each CI run log. For example:

```
% appveyor_ssh appveyor@67.225.164.41 -p 22033

% appveyor_rdp /v:67.225.164.53:33816
```

When logging in, you can `touch BLOCK` (linux/mac), or `right-click-new-textfile-BLOCK[.txt]` (win) to block the worker from exiting -- up to the maximum run duration (60min). Please remove blocks in order to make slots free, as soon as you no longer need them.

FTR: Here is the last CI run log from the repository I was working in: https://ci.appveyor.com/project/mih/appveyor-datalad/builds/37168575
